IReconnectTopoEdgeImp Class Reference

List of all members.

Detailed Description

The FdoIReconnectTopoEdge interface defines the ReconnectTopoEdge command, which modifies an edge's connection(s) to a node to move to a different node, and allows the geometry of the edge to change simultaneously. Other changes to topology are not allowed by this command. Any features that have topological relationships to the edge will be affected.

Note: This Help topic is provided for informational use only. There is no interface or support provided. Autodesk reserves the right to change the software related to the content herein.


Public Member Functions

System::Void Dispose ()
NAMESPACE_FDO_COMMANDS_FEATURE::IFeatureReader * Execute ()
 Executes the MoveTopoEdge command and, if FdoIActivateTopologyInCommandResults is in effect, returns a reader with the affected primitives and features.
__property NAMESPACE_FDO_COMMANDS::PropertyValueCollection * get_EdgeId ()
 Gets the identifier of the edge to be reconnected. This is the accessor for the value that the caller sets via SetEdgeId.
__property NAMESPACE_FDO_COMMANDS::PropertyValueCollection * get_EdgePropertyValues ()
 Gets the properties of the edge to be moved. The caller would be expected to assign a new value for the "Geometry" property, as well as assigning a new value for one distinct node -- either "StartNode" or "EndNode", or both if they were the same previously. Normally, the StartNode and EndNode properties are read-only and system-maintained. They are caller-updateable for the ReconnectTopoEdge command.
__property NAMESPACE_FDO_COMMANDS_LOCKING::ILockConflictReader * get_LockConflicts ()
 Updating objects might result in lock conflicts if objects to be updated are not exclusively locked for the user attempting to update the object. If objects to be updated are not exclusively locked for the user attempting to update the object, a lock conflict report is generated. The function GetLockConflicts returns a lock conflict reader providing access to the list of lock conflicts that occurred during the execution of the update operation.
__property System::String * get_TopologyName ()
 Gets the name of the topology to affect. This is the accessor for the value that the caller sets via SetTopologyName.
FdoIReconnectTopoEdge * GetImpObj ()
 IReconnectTopoEdgeImp (System::IntPtr unmanaged, System::Boolean autoDelete)
__property System::Void set_EdgeId (NAMESPACE_FDO_COMMANDS::PropertyValueCollection *edgeId)
 Sets the identifier of the edge to be moved.
__property System::Void set_TopologyName (System::String *topologyName)
 Sets the name of the topology to affect.
